title: The Vasundhara Pendant: Polki Diamond and Gemstone Divine Adornment
materials: 22K Gold with Hyderabadi Polish. Set with Polki Diamonds (uncut diamonds) of varying cuts
showcasing natural inclusions. Accented with fine-quality cabochon Emeralds and natural Coral beads.
features: Inspired by traditional Telugu temple architecture. The pendant features a floral-motif center design meticulously set with Polki diamonds in a closed setting, creating a vintage allure. Dangles of emeralds and coral add a pop of color. Handmade by skilled artisans using the age-old Kundan technique. The antique finish gives the piece a timeless appeal, reminiscent of heritage jewelry.
colors: antique sheen. The Polki diamonds are predominantly colorless
offering subtle sparkle. The emeralds provide a rich green hue
complemented by the vibrant orange-red of the coral beads. The combination creates a traditional South Indian color palette.
occasions: and grand celebrations. Also suitable as a statement piece for cultural events or to elevate modern attire with a touch of tradition.
description: A unique fusion of tradition and elegance, handcrafted by master artisans in Hyderabad. The use of Polki diamonds, emeralds, and coral offers a vibrant contrast and showcases exceptional craftsmanship. This pendant holds significant cultural value and symbolizes prosperity and good fortune. The antique finish adds a touch of history and makes it a timeless heirloom piece. The piece boasts intricate details and robust construction ensures durability.
